channel.title: Manual Upgrades on Crunchy Data PostgreSQL Operator Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Manual Upgrades on Crunchy Data PostgreSQL Operator Documentation

item.title: Manual Upgrade - Operator 3.5
item.description: Upgrading the Crunchy PostgreSQL Operator from Version 3.5 to Param "operatorVersion" not found: [1;36m"/opt/git/priv-all-portal-docs/etl/postgres_operator/dst/content/Upgrade/manual/upgrade35.md:7:66"[0m This section will outline the procedure to upgrade a given cluster created using PostgreSQL Operator 3.5.x to PostgreSQL Operator version Param "operatorVersion" not found: [1;36m"/opt/git/priv-all-portal-docs/etl/postgres_operator/dst/content/Upgrade/manual/upgrade35.md:9:139"[0m. This version of the PostgreSQL Operator has several fundamental changes to the existing PGCluster structure and deployment model. Most notably, all PGClusters use the new Crunchy PostgreSQL HA container in place of the previous Crunchy PostgreSQL containers.

item.title: Manual Upgrade - Operator 4
item.description: Manual PostgreSQL Operator 4 Upgrade Procedure Below are the procedures for upgrading to version Param "operatorVersion" not found: [1;36m"/opt/git/priv-all-portal-docs/etl/postgres_operator/dst/content/Upgrade/manual/upgrade4.md:9:51"[0m of the Crunchy PostgreSQL Operator using the Bash or Ansible installation methods. This version of the PostgreSQL Operator has several fundamental changes to the existing PGCluster structure and deployment model. Most notably for those upgrading from 4.1 and below, all PGClusters use the new Crunchy PostgreSQL HA container in place of the previous Crunchy PostgreSQL containers.
